Package de.jvstvshd.localstream.network.packets

Class Packet<Handler extends PacketHandler>

java.lang.Object
de.jvstvshd.localstream.network.packets.Packet<Handler>
Type Parameters:
Handler - The handler the packet should be processed with.
All Implemented Interfaces:
PacketComparable<Packet<?>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientHandlingPacket, ServerHandlingPacket
public abstract class Packet<Handler extends PacketHandler> extends Object implements PacketComparable<Packet<?>>
The super class of all packets.
Packets are used to write data simply through ByteBufs/PacketBuffers.

      public abstract void read​(PacketBuffer buffer)
      Reads data that is essential for the packet into it's fields using the PacketBuffer buffer.
      Parameters:

    • write

      public abstract void write​(PacketBuffer buffer)
      Writes essential packet data via the buffer to the other connection participant.
      Parameters:
      buffer - PacketBuffer in which the data should be written, comes mostly from encoding methods.

    • process

      public abstract void process​(Handler handler)
      Processes the packet with the handler.
      Parameters:
